meanings.definition: More foolish or stupid than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He felt schmuckier than his classmates after failing the test.
meanings.sent2: The boy's actions were getting schmuckier by the minute.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at juggling was even schmuckier than his failed magic trick.
meanings.sent4: The idea of jumping off a moving swing seemed schmuckier than diving into a pool of jelly.
meanings.sent5: The clown's oversized shoes made him look even schmuckier.

meanings.definition: More obnoxious or contemptible than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her behavior at the party was schmuckier than anyone else's.
meanings.sent2: The neighbor's loud music was becoming schmuckier every night.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to move from the warm spot on the couch was both cute and schmuckier.
meanings.sent4: The politician's lies were as schmuckier as a snake oil salesman's promises.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled child's tantrum was the schmuckier display of entitlement.
